definitions.explanation: root trait for application information

hasParameters.name: releaseVersion
hasParameters.explanation: semantic version number of the application introducing this entity

definitions.explanation: root trait for information about the CDM itself.

hasParameters.name: versionNumber
hasParameters.explanation: semantic version number of the entity

definitions.explanation: identifies standard groups of attributes in CDM entities.
a set of references to attributeGroups
The 'old' name for this entity before it was fixed to make it type specific
holds a list of entity references
localized text

hasAttributes.name: languageTag
hasAttributes.explanation: A BCP 47 language tag describing the associated display text

definitions.explanation: Marks an attribute added to an entity to document or represent a concept, often regarding other attributes. When working with data, be aware that virtual attributes might never have corresponding data values in an entity's partition or might only have data values if special measures are taken to manifest them.
Associates a list of localized string with an object

hasParameters.name: localizedDisplayText
hasParameters.explanation: a reference to the constant entity holding the list of localized text

definitions.explanation: Holds the list of language specific display text for an object.
Holds the list of language specific descriptive text for an object.
a localized list of descriptions for possible values in a listLookup type attribute

hasAttributes.name: attributeValue
hasAttributes.explanation: One of the enumerated values for this attribute

hasAttributes.name: displayOrder
hasAttributes.explanation: The presentation order of the enumerated value

definitions.explanation: a localized list of descriptions for possible values in a listLookupCorrelated type attribute

hasAttributes.name: correlatedValue
hasAttributes.explanation: value for the correlated attribute that corresponds to the associated attributeValue

definitions.explanation: a localized list of descriptions for possible values in a listLookupString type attribute

hasAttributes.name: attributeValue
hasAttributes.explanation: One of the enumerated values for this attribute

hasAttributes.name: displayOrder
hasAttributes.explanation: The presentation order of the enumerated value

definitions.explanation: a localized list of descriptions for possible values in a listLookupWellKnown type attribute

hasAttributes.name: description
hasAttributes.explanation: A description of the meaning of the look up value.

hasAttributes.name: uniqueIdentifier
hasAttributes.explanation: A domain specific unique identifier such as a URI or GUID for the well known value.

definitions.explanation: An attribute has a default value
The attribute value may be set to NULL.
The requirement level for setting values into this attribute in CDS for Applications or for including this attribute in entities created in CDS for Analytics
maximum length or value constraints
the values of an attribute are taken from or looked up from a fixed list of possibilities
the values of an attribute are taken from or looked up from a fixed list of possibilities that represent correlated status
the values of an attribute are taken from or looked up from a fixed list of possibilities
The values of an attribute are taken from or looked up from a fixed list of possibilities which are defined in an identified public location.

hasParameters.name: uniqueIdentifier
hasParameters.explanation: The identified public location for the complete set of possible values

definitions.explanation: the attribute represents the current state of the entity.
the related attribute describes the current state of the entity
the attribute value is correlated with the sourceAttribute
the related attribute describes the current status of the entity in its current state
One integer value from a defined list of possibilities
A set of one or more values from a defined list of possibilities
One integer value from a defined list of possibilities where the list represents correlated status
One string value from a defined list of possibilities
One string value from a defined list of possibilities which are defined in an identified public location.
the attribute value is the result of a calculation on the sourceAttribute
The base trait for partition specific traits.
The value is the file format settings of a partition CSV file.

hasParameters.name: columnHeaders
hasParameters.explanation: Indicates whether the .csv file has headers.

hasParameters.name: csvStyle
hasParameters.explanation: The CSV style which is always CsvStyle.QuoteAlways or CsvStyle.QuoteAfterDelimiter.

hasParameters.name: delimiter
hasParameters.explanation: The delimiter type in the .csv file.

hasParameters.name: quoteStyle
hasParameters.explanation: The quote style which is always QuoteStyle.Csv or QuoteStyle.None.

hasParameters.name: encoding
hasParameters.explanation: The character encoding in the .csv file.

hasParameters.name: escape
hasParameters.explanation: The character used to escape quotes inside a quoted string in the .csv file.

hasParameters.name: newline
hasParameters.explanation: The character used to indicate the end of a record in the .csv file.

hasParameters.name: quote
hasParameters.explanation: The character used to quote text strings in the .csv file.

hasParameters.name: skipLines
hasParameters.explanation: The number of lines to skip over at the start of the .csv file.

definitions.explanation: The value is the file format settings of a partition parquet file.
The partition path points to one complete folder of Spark Delta Lake data. Options allow for time travel access to the data.

hasParameters.name: versionAsOf
hasParameters.explanation: the optional time travel version of data to read. If both versionAsOf and timestampAsOf are set, then version takes precedence

hasParameters.name: timestampAsOf
hasParameters.explanation: the optional time travel timestamp of data to read. If both versionAsOf and timestampAsOf are set, then version takes precedence

definitions.explanation: The value denotes culture in the partition files.
Represents a correlation with model.json to CDM model conversion.
The value denotes the version number set in a converted model.json file
The value denotes model.json annotations which have not been recognized.
The value denotes a reference model map containing multiple id-location pairs used for reference entity resolution.
The value denotes information about a service/entity who is owning a model.

hasParameters.name: application
hasParameters.explanation: The name of the managing entity or service.

definitions.explanation: A level of abstraction assigned to an Entity schema. Logical schema descriptions use complex dataTypes, inheritance, and entities as attributes. Resolved descriptions contain none of those things, only final trait and attribute sets are shown. A composition schema manipulates, guides or re-states parts of logical schemas to produce one resolved schema.
The schema object has an identifier, which is a string, specified as the parameter of the trait. This allows writers to define additional identification values.

hasParameters.name: identifier
hasParameters.explanation: The identifier for the schema object. There is no uniqueness guarantee enforced by CDM. It is a contract between reader and writer of the schema.
